name: Four Points by Sheraton Munchen Central

reviews.text: We spent one night here, my husband, daughter, and myself, and had a wonderful experience. We received a large room with two double beds, even had a balcony. The carpet and wallpaper might have been a little dated, but that's not a reason to complain for a rate of 89 euros. Very close to an underground station. Oh, and our rate also included the breakfast. I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Large room, helpful staff

likes.disliked: — Nothing, everyone was kind to the weird American family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my wife stayed at Four Points Central from October 18th to 22nd.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.liked: — Comfortable, extremely clean, location, breakfast and reception staff

reviews.text: Rates: Booked through travel agent in Brazil - EUR 105 / night, including breakfast.
reviews.title: Clean modern hotel with very helpful reception

reviews.text: Location: Close to Central Station, Karlsplatz and Marienplatz (15 min walk) but the quicker options are tram (#19 I think) or U-Bahn (Theresienwiese). Excellent location for those who are going to Oktoberfest. There is a huge decoration store (XXXLutz) and an Electronics store (Saturn) next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great mid-range choice

likes.disliked: — Not exactly as central as the name suggests but not a problem for us

reviews.text: Rooms: Good sized, nice furniture - really comfortable; good heating and excellent bathroom (extremely clean). Mini-bar stuff is very expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent Sheraton service as always!

reviews.text: Wie stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 01-Apr-06 to 04-Apr-06 and it was really a delightful experience. Our room was very clean and equipped with all modern amenities. The front desk staff (save one lady who checked us in and was quite rude and impolite) were very helpful and accommodting. We requested for an extra quilt and pillow at the reception and it was brought to our room within 15 minutes by one of the matrons who profusedly apologized to us for not bringing it sooner (what a lovely gesture, I must say). The breakfast was extraordinarily great with a variety of items to choose from. The hotel's staff was extremely courteous and friendly and we would definitely be staying in this hotel when we visit Munich again.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was OK. It had a good price/value relation, although Breakfast is a bit expensive at 14 Eur per person. Plenty of Starbucks' stores popping up as a better alternative. The room was spacious with some nice bathroom ammenities available. The staff was excellent and efficient. Distance to downtown is walkable if you want to take 20 minutes.
reviews.title: A one nighter
Great Location for Oktoberfesters
reviews.text: Just came back from Oktoberfest and this is a great spot to stay if you are going to the festival. Located just a few blocks from the festival grounds and very reasonably priced. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. Only bad thing was no AC. Pls note that its proximity to the fest lends itself to being fairly noisy at night, but hey, its Oktoberfest- you should expect that.

reviews.title: Delightful Hotel, a little out of the way
reviews.text: I selected the Four Points Central Hotel by Sheraton based on price and location. Since I have stayed at the hotel, the location is further from the Munich HauptBahnhof than I expected, which is a good 15 minutes walk if you have suitcases or a backpack with you.

The hotel check in staff were very pleasant and the room I occupied was a large room. It was a dark room, with wood panneling for closets down one side, and the bathroom was a gray marble like color. The bathroom was extraordinarily spacious and would be quite suitable for two people in a room.
reviews.title: Good Hotel value for money

reviews.text: Had a nice sized room for three w/breakfast. Nice, modern room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great buffet breakfast. Short walk to center. If it were closer the price would be much higher. Easy walk to Augustiner Biergarten. Good (but crowded) restaurant three minute walk away. Good take-out Pizza from a hole-in-the-wall just down the block. We paid 79 euros for three people. The breakfast alone was worth half that.
reviews.title: Good hotel Great Value

reviews.text: My family and I spent 3 nights here in April 2007 and just loved it. The front desk staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The room were big, clean and modern. The beds were so comfortable and the pillows were hude with feather down. It is located about a 10 minute walk from the main train station and just around the corner from the park where they hold the Oktoberfest. We were away for six weeks and this hotel had the best breakfast by far and it changed each day. If you can afford this hotel do it.
reviews.title: Loved It

likes.disliked: — No view from the lower floors

reviews.text: We stayed here only one night but would stay here again and again if we went back to Munich. We were upgraded for free to a junior suite. I have not stayed in an American Hotel with this much room. We had a large TV, a sitting area, huge closets, whole wall window, and the largest bathroom I have ever seen in a chain hotel. (It was a ridiculous amount of room). After traveling throughout Europe for 13 days in European size hotel rooms I thought I had gone to heaven!
reviews.title: Book, Book, Book this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedding was comfortable, the room was fully stocked, and the front desk was SSSOOOOOO helpful! The front desk clerk helped with cab service, directions to the bank, and directions to the E-phone…always with a smile. The hotel area is very quiet.
reviews.title: Not bad for a stay in Munich

likes.disliked: — No spa/sauna as indicated on web site

reviews.text: The hotel is just steps away from the train station but it is a distance from the pedestrian zones. About a 45 minute walk, however it is just a short taxi ride from the hotel to the shopping areas. It’s worth the ride.
reviews.title: loved this hotel

reviews.text: My room was quite large and came with free internet/mini bar but it was quite dirty. My white curtains in my room were the color grey from the dirt. There is no AC but they supply you fans. I found it not central to anything and it needs a definate remodel. The room is outdated, worn out and dirty.
reviews.title: Not Central/Outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located only a few minutes walk from the Oktoberfest grounds, this hotel's location can't be beat. You can have a hot breakfast, get to the tents when they open and be assured of getting a seat even without a reservation. After downing a liter or two, saunter back to your room for a nap. After a rest, it's only minutes to return to the festival for more fun! Okay, the elevator did break down once or twice. The front desk staff was very helpful and spoke English well. The biggest drawback was the extremely hard mattress. Of course, you must also put up with the loud & obnoxious types who walk past your door shouting at 2am but that goes with the festival. Overall, the hotel can't be beat on the strength of its location (assuming you are going for Oktoberfest).
reviews.title: Great for Oktoberfest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off I have to say that the selection of this hotel was perfect for purposed of visiting Oktoberfest in Munich. Quite literally you walk out the front door, down a short walk to the end of the street, cross the street, and you are at the entrace to the Theresienwiese grounds. Better yet, reverse that walk after your day at the Oktoberfest is over.
reviews.title: Good for Oktoberfest

reviews.text: However, the hotel had quite a few issues. The elevator was broken which isn't a big deal. Fixing it at 2:00 am is a big deal! The water in the shower bounces from hot to cold and back again. There is no AC so if it's hot out, you need to open the windows. Not that big a deal but it is when there's a guy outside your window running the leaf blower very early in the morning. The clerks were kind and spoke good english. Parking in the garage below is not included in your rate.
reviews.title: I feel cheated

reviews.text: I think i could only recommend this hotel if your were there for octoberfest. We arrived after 30 hours up straight an was greeted by the a nice front desk clerk. We were promply given a room with someone elses stuff in it. so we had to drag all of our stuff back down to checkin to get another room.
reviews.title: A truthful Review
